wisdom.sentence: A bit of talcum Is always walcum
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.sentence: A box without hinges, key, or lid, Yet golden treasure inside is hid.
wisdom.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

wisdom.sentence: A man is like a rusty wheel on a rusty cart, He sings his song as he rattles along and then he falls apart.
wisdom.author: Richard Thompson

wisdom.sentence: A man of genius makes no mistakes. His errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery.
wisdom.author: James Joyce, "Ulysses"

wisdom.sentence: A man who fishes for marlin in ponds will put his money in Etruscan bonds.
A robin redbreast in a cage Puts all Heaven in a rage.
wisdom.author: Blake

wisdom.sentence: A truth that's told with bad intent Beats all the lies you can invent.
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.sentence: Ah, but a man's grasp should exceed his reach,  Or what's a heaven for ?
wisdom.author: Robert Browning, "Andrea del Sarto"

wisdom.sentence: All who joy would win Must share it -- Happiness was born a twin.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.sentence: And if sometime, somewhere, someone asketh thee, "Who kilt thee?", tell them it 'twas the Doones of Bagworthy!

wisdom.author: Joan Baez

wisdom.sentence: And miles to go before I sleep.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.sentence: And the silence came surging softly backwards When the plunging hooves were gone...
wisdom.author: Walter de La Mare, "The Listeners"

wisdom.sentence: Angels we have heard on High Tell us to go out and Buy.
wisdom.author: Tom Lehrer

wisdom.sentence: April is the cruellest month...
wisdom.author: Thomas Stearns Eliot

wisdom.sentence: As for the women, though we scorn and flout 'em, We may live with, but cannot live without 'em.
wisdom.author: Frederic Reynolds

wisdom.sentence: At times discretion should be thrown aside, and with the foolish we should play the fool.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.sentence: Avoid Quiet and Placid persons unless you are in Need of Sleep.

wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.sentence: Be assured that a walk through the ocean of most Souls would scarcely get your Feet wet.  Fall not in Love, therefore: it will stick to your face.
wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.sentence: Be valiant, but not too venturous. Let thy attire be comely, but not costly.
wisdom.author: John Lyly

wisdom.sentence: Beauty is truth, truth beauty, that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
wisdom.author: John Keats

wisdom.sentence: Big M, Little M, many mumbling mice Are making midnight music in the moonlight, Mighty nice!

wisdom.author: Julie Brown, "Will I Make it Through the Eighties?"

wisdom.sentence: By the yard, life is hard. By the inch, it's a cinch.

wisdom.author: The Beach Boys

wisdom.sentence: Certainly there are things in life that money can't buy, But it's very funny -- did you ever try buying them without money?
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.sentence: Children aren't happy without something to ignore, And that's what parents were created for.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.sentence: Come, landlord, fill the flowing bowl until it does run over, Tonight we will all merry be -- tomorrow we'll get sober.
wisdom.author: John Fletcher, "The Bloody Brother", II, 2

wisdom.sentence: Come, muse, let us sing of rats!
wisdom.author: From a poem by James Grainger, 1721-1767

wisdom.sentence: Declared guilty... of displaying feelings of an almost human nature.

wisdom.sentence: Don't wake me up too soon... Gonna take a ride across the moon... You and me.

wisdom.author: Goethe, "Faust"

wisdom.sentence: Every love's the love before In a duller dress.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, "Summary"

wisdom.sentence: Every man is as God made him, ay, and often worse.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.sentence: Get in touch with your feelings of hostility against the dying light.
wisdom.author: Dylan Thomas [paraphrased periphrastically]

wisdom.sentence: Go placidly amid the noise and waste, and remember what value there may be in owning a piece thereof.
wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.sentence: Hanging on in quiet desperation is the English way.
wisdom.author: Pink Floyd

wisdom.sentence: He who invents adages for others to peruse takes along rowboat when going on cruise.
He who loses, wins the race, And parallel lines meet in space.
wisdom.author: John Boyd, "Last Starship from Earth"

wisdom.sentence: ...his disciples lead him in; he just does the rest.
wisdom.author: The Who, "Tommy"

wisdom.sentence: How can you have any pudding if you don't eat your meat?

wisdom.sentence: I can't complain, but sometimes I still do.

wisdom.sentence: I don't know what Descartes' got, But booze can do what Kant cannot.

wisdom.sentence: I don't wanna argue, and I don't wanna fight, But there will definitely be a party tonight...

wisdom.author: William Blake, "Jerusalem"

wisdom.sentence: I owe, I owe, It's off to work I go...

wisdom.sentence: I'm free -- and freedom tastes of reality.

wisdom.sentence: i'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart.

wisdom.sentence: If a nation expects to be ignorant and free, ... it expects what never was and never will be.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.sentence: If I promised you the moon and the stars, would you believe it?

wisdom.sentence: In the land of the dark the Ship of the Sun is driven by the Grateful Dead.

wisdom.sentence: In Xanadu did Kubla Khan a stately pleasure dome decree But only if the NFL to a franchise would agree.

wisdom.author: Proverbs 19:2

wisdom.sentence: It's gonna be alright, It's almost midnight, And I've got two more bottles of wine.

wisdom.author: Tom Lehrer, "Poisoning Pigeons in the Park"

wisdom.sentence: Life is like a tin of sardines. We're, all of us, looking for the key.

wisdom.sentence: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
wisdom.author: John Lennon, "Beautiful Boy"

wisdom.sentence: Love in your heart wasn't put there to stay. Love isn't love 'til you give it away.
wisdom.author: Oscar Hammerstein II

wisdom.sentence: New York's got the ways and means; Just won't let you be.

wisdom.sentence: Next, upon a stool, we've a sight to make you drool. Seven virgins and a mule, keep it cool, keep it cool.

wisdom.sentence: No rock so hard but that a little wave May beat admission in a thousand years.

wisdom.sentence: No sooner had Edger Allen Poe Finished his old Raven, then he started his Old Crow.

wisdom.sentence: Oh, by the way, which one's Pink?

wisdom.sentence: One thing about the past. It's likely to last.

wisdom.sentence: Parsley   is gharsley.

wisdom.sentence: Power, like a desolating pestilence, Pollutes whate'er it touches...

wisdom.sentence: Remember that whatever misfortune may be your lot, it could only be worse in Cleveland.
wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.sentence: She asked me, "What's your sign?" I blinked and answered "Neon," I thought I'd blow her mind...

Sun in the night, everyone is together, Ascending into the heavens, life is forever.
wisdom.author: Brand X, "Moroccan Roll/Sun in the Night"

wisdom.sentence: Sweet sixteen is beautiful Bess, And her voice is changing -- from "No" to "Yes".

wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.sentence: That feeling just came over me.
wisdom.author: Albert DeSalvo, the "Boston Strangler"

wisdom.sentence: The all-softening overpowering knell, The tocsin of the soul, -- the dinner bell.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.sentence: The Bird of Time has but a little way to fly ... and the bird is on the wing.
wisdom.author: Omar Khayyam

wisdom.sentence: The difference between us is not very far, cruising for burgers in daddy's new car.

wisdom.author: Andrew Marvell

wisdom.sentence: The hope that springs eternal Springs right up your behind.
wisdom.author: Ian Drury, "This Is What We Find"

wisdom.sentence: The thrill is here, but it won't last long You'd better have your fun before it moves along...

wisdom.sentence: The truth you speak has no past and no future. It is, and that's all it needs to be.

To err is human, To purr feline.
wisdom.author: Robert Byrne

wisdom.sentence: To err is human, to purr feline. To err is human, two curs canine. To err is human, to moo bovine.

wisdom.author: Emily Dickinson (on hacking?)

wisdom.sentence: We don't need no education, we don't need no thought control.

wisdom.sentence: We gotta get out of this place, If it's the last thing we ever do.

wisdom.sentence: What awful irony is this? We are as gods, but know it not.
What we Are is God's gift to us. What we Become is our gift to God.

wisdom.author: Tina Turner

wisdom.sentence: When a lion meets another with a louder roar, the first lion thinks the last a bore.
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: When in panic, fear and doubt, Drink in barrels, eat, and shout.
When in trouble or in doubt, run in circles, scream and shout.
Where's the man could ease a heart Like a satin gown?
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, "The Satin Dress"

wisdom.sentence: Whether you can hear it or not, The Universe is laughing behind your back.
wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.sentence: Who does not love wine, women, and song, Remains a fool his whole life long.
wisdom.author: Johann Heinrich Voss

wisdom.sentence: Who to himself is law no law doth need, offends no law, and is a king indeed.
wisdom.author: George Chapman

wisdom.sentence: With/Without - and who'll deny it's what the fighting's all about?
wisdom.author: Pink Floyd

wisdom.sentence: Yea from the table of my memory I'll wipe away all trivial fond records.

wisdom.sentence: You may be right, I may be crazy, But it just may be a lunatic you're looking for!
wisdom.author: Billy Joel

wisdom.sentence: Your wise men don't know how it feels To be thick as a brick.
wisdom.author: Jethro Tull, "Thick As A Brick"
